page.title: 13TOURISM - Milford Common.
page.content: The Chase is used all the year round. Local use is high(see survey)but others visit from this country and abroad There are many open areas for the public to use such as the Common at Milford.Here there are picnic tables and a place to park cars.The grass is kept short and so families bring balls frisby's and cricket sets to play There is The Little Fawn (Restaurant) Wimpey Bar (fast food) and Barley Mow Pub) nearby.Perhaps because of these Milford Common is the most used and crowded part.Places like Brocton nature reserve and Old Acre valley are much less well known and used.Coach parties, mainly old people from the Black Country,visit the Common and have a meal or Sunday lunch at the Little Fawn. The Wardens make a car count on the official parks and estimate 1500 people on a summer Sunday (S.Jones 11
